chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Mailhot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court Costs as to both Count Nos. 1 and 2 are paid in full from cash bond previously posted.  The balance of the cash bond has been refunded to the poster.
Defendant to obtain an HSED (High School Equivalency Diploma or GED during the pendency of probation term.

Defendant is not to possess any electronic device that is capable of taking a picture or sending a picture or that is capable of sending any type of electronic message.  Any use or possession of a cell phone is solely subject to agent approval.  No contact with any females under the age of 18 years unless in the presence of a parent or guardian.  No contact whatsoever with V.M.S., R.G.K. and/or E.M.R.

Defendant to comply with any Sex Offender Treatment as deemed appropriate by the Supervising Agent.    DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.   The following uncharged referrals will not be charged and are read-in to the record: E.M.R. with an offense date of 12/10/2014 contrary to s. 948.12(1m) and R.G.K. with an offense date of 01/05/2015 contrary to s. 948.015(1)(a).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

miscConds.notes: See Comments noted above for Count No. 1.

timeConds.notes: ***Per correspondence from the Court dated March 28, 2016, the defendant's report date amended to April 15, 2016***  No Good Time Credit.  Huber Privileges granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to obtain an HSED during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have no contact with any females under the age of 18 years of age, excluding biological child. No Contact with V.M.S. (dob-5/10/2001). The defendant is prohibited from using any electronic device capable of electronic communication by text, social media etc. at the discretion of the supervising agent.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   Complete a Sex Offender Treatment Assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Supervising Agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

of Sentencing on Revocation -- April 17, 2018
Revoked
Inmate Request to the Court, Dated 4/20/2018 - Denied

9:04 am cases called-15Cf144 & 18CF18. Defendant Michael J. Mailhot in court with attorney Melinda R Alfredson-Clausen.  Defendant Michael J. Mailhot in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record. 18CF18-  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  No Contest to Count 1. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads in Count 2 & Count 3. 15CF144-Counsel have received revocation order and warrant-no corrections or additions by either counsel. Chapter 950 compliance. Sentencing argument by DA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Alfredson-Clausen. Statement by defendant. Court makes statment prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: 15CF144-Count 1- 9 months WCJ. Credit for 130 days time served. Costs paid in full. COUNT 3- 3 years 6 months Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 18 months Initial Confinement and 24 months Extended Supervision. Credit for 249 days time served.  Concurrent to Count 1. CONDITIONS: No contact with any females under the age of 18 years of age excluding biological child. No Contact with VMS-dob-5/10/2001.  Sex Offender Treatment as prescribed by Agent and DOC. Complete HSED.  Prohibited from use of any device capable of electronic communication by text, social media, etc at the discretion of the supervising agent. AODA and follow through, Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Court finds the defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.  18CF18-SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. Consecutive to Count 3 of 15CF144. Credit for 1 day.  CONDITIONS:  No contact with any females under the age of 18 years of age excluding biological child. No Contact with VMS- dob-5/10/2001. Sex Offender Treatment as prescribed by Agent and DOC. Complete HSED.  Prohibited from use of any device capable of electronic communication by text, social media, etc at the discretion of the supervising agent. AODA and follow through, Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on Revocation on April 17, 2018 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:32 PM: Defendant Michael J. Mailhot in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint global resolution recited.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - INFO Stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's Motion to Amend Ct 1 INFO - 4th Deg SA - contrary to s. 940.225(3m) Class A Misd Plea:  NC  Ct 3 INFO Plea: NC    Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Def understands that as part of this resolution State agrees not to charge precharging offenses relating to offense dates of 1/5/2015 and 12/10/2014.   Statement by Def:  Yes.  State argues as to request for expungement.  Argument by SPD as to expungement.  The Court:  Ct 1:  S/W - 2 yrs probation.  Ct 3:  S/W - 3 yrs probation - concurrent terms to one another.  Conditions of Supervision:  Ct 3 only - 120 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, 2 daysTS credit - Report 4/1/2016; complete any SOT as agent finds appropriate; Complete HSED or GED; Not to possess any electronic device that is capable of taking a picture or sending a picture or that is capable of sending any type of electronic message; any use or possession of any cell phone is solely subject to agent approval; no contact with any females under 18 years unless in the presence of a parent or guardian; no contact with VMS, RGK and EMR; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP - plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
